absolutely addicitve kale moti biryani   lunch that s complete; 01/11/2002; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, main dish, beans, asian, indian, 1 day or more, holiday event, vegetarian, stove top, dietary, ramadan, lentils, equipment; 1. soak the black urad dal overnight in plenty of water; 2. the following morning , drain , and replenish with fresh water; 3. add baking soda and salt; 4. boil until cooked; 5. drain; 6. keep aside; 7. wash the rice and soak for 15 minutes in water; 8. drain; 9. boil rice in 3; 10. 5 cups water with salt and garam masala powder; 11. lower flame , partially cover and cook till almost done; 12. keep aside; 13. now start preparing the urad dal mixture; 14. for this , heat butter / ghee in a skillet; 15. add ginger-garlic paste and stir-fry till the raw smell is gone; 16. add red chilli and turmeric powders and 3 tbsps; 17. water; 18. mix well; 19. cook for 2 minutes; 20. add the chopped green chilli and chopped tomatoes; 21. cook on low flame till the gravy becomes thick and the fat leaves the masala; 22. stir in the urad dal , allowing the gravy to coat the same; 23. sprinkle chopped corriander leaves , slit green chillies , garam masala powder , quartered tomatoes and fried onions; 24. lightly toss; 25. add rice , evenly , over the garnished urad dal mixture; 26. place a moist cloth on top; 27. cover with a tight fitting lid and seal the lid with atta dough; 28. put the sealed skillet on'dum' on low flame on your gas stove for 15-20 minutes , so as to let all the flavours blend beautifully with the rice , and the rice be cooked thoroughly well; 29. break the seal once the time is up , remove the cloth and transfer the rice to a serving dish; 30. serve hot with raita or a dollop of yogurt on top and / or a curry of your choice; 31. do not blame me if you get addicted to this; please note: the words "kale moti" refer to the small grains of black urad dal. 'kale' here is a hindi(indian) word for black colour which happens to be the colour the lentils used in this recipe. 'moti' means pearls...what this means here is that this rice dish is a treat of black lentils and is as delicious as pearls are beautiful. 'kale' here does not refer to any kind of cabbage. have a spoon of this and you'll want to come and hug me, kiss me, probably even marry me for sharing this:) i got this recipe from the 'thursday' magazine (contributed by manisha nanda, and she got 50 us dollars as prize money for this!), but, slightly tweaked it, to make it on the spicy side. it's not too spicy, its just great! the original recipe is on a sweeter side(more yogurt and some milk as well). i am absolutely head over heels crazy about this biryani. it's vegetarian, a complete meal in itself, finger food(oh yes - you must eat it with your fingers to relish every grain of this dish that is absolutely priceless, its so tasty that i'd personally keep giving it stars till i dropped dead:) not a bad idea to take a plate of this to your girlfriend if she loves rice and is cross with you, she'll jump up and marry you, oh yeah, i bet she will :) try it! :) this is one dish i really really love, inspite of the butter and rice(both which make a man fat), this one's just perfect to have once in a while, when your just sitting on that bubble of "i reached my goal" or even if you need something to inspire you to do something, try this dish. not only will you see sweet dreams the night you make it, oh, you will be filled with a magical charisma! if i could, i would love to donate plates filled with this to every poor man, woman and child alive on the planet. i really really love this dish with my mind, body and soul :) have it for your diwali lunch/dinner party(with just 4 days to go before the festival day, you know what's going to be cooking at my end!), your birthday party(attn: troy- i'm thinking nov 1st and of you- happy birthday a day in advance!), your new year party(just 60 days left for 2002 to end!), your wedding anniversary, any time when you want to have a treat, and enjoy the food of a king, go for this! i'm dedicating this recipe to troy hakala as i know from his 'about me' page that he loves indian food, and, secondly, its his birthday on nov 1st !; basmati rice, salt, green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaves, urad dal, baking soda, salted butter, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, low-fat plain yogurt, tomatoes, green chili, coriander leaves, green chilies, onions, garam masala powder; 19

focaccia   rosemary are going steady; 05/07/2002; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, healthy, lunch, side dishes, potatoes, vegetables, european, dinner party, italian, dietary, low cholesterol, low saturated fat, comfort food, healthy 2, low in something, taste mood, 4 hours or less; 1. pour 1 cup of boiling water over 1 tbsp of rosemary and allow to cool to lukewarm- about 20 minutes; 2. strain the water into a cup , discard the rosemary; 3. add honey and stir; 4. put the yeast into a large bowl and pour the lukewarm honey / rosemary water in and let stand until foamy about 10 minutes; 5. stir salt and 1 tbsp of the olive oil into the yeast mixture; 6. add mashed potatoes and enough flour to make a kneadable dough; 7. flour your hands and the work surface and knead for 5-10 minutes until the dough is elastic and looks smooth; 8. spray a bowl with veggie oil and rotate the dough in the bowl; 9. cover with plastic wrap , place in a warm place and allow to double in bulk takes apprx 45- 60 minutes; 10. punch down and knead for at least an other minute; 11. spray a 17 x 11" baking sheet or somethong similar and place the dough on it and pat it into an 17 x 11" size , even it out so it is the same depth all over; 12. brush with the 2 tsp of olive oil , sprinkle with the parmesan , onions and the remaining 1 tbsp of rosemary; 13. cover loosely with plastic and allow to rise for about 30 minutes; 14. heat oven to 400f and bake the focaccia for apprx 17 minutes or until it is golden and puffed; 15. remove from oven cool slightly on wire rack; 16. cut into 12 pieces and serve; home made focaccia is heaven. add other toppings like sundried tomatoes, olives what ever but remember everything you add you also add calories!; boiling water, dried rosemary, honey, active dry yeast, salt, olive oil, mashed potatoes, flour, parmesan cheese, onion; 10

13. pour into a medium saucepan; 14. stir in chicken broth; 15. bring to a boil; 16. reduce heat to medium-low; 17. cover and simmer to blend flavors , about 10 minutes; 18. remove from heat and keep warm; 19. to make bread bowls: preheat oven to 400 degrees; 20. using a sharp knife , cut off the top of each roll; 21. pull out soft centers , leaving 1 / 2-inch thick shells; 22. discard soft bread; 23. reserve tops; 24. place"bowls" and tops on a baking sheet; 25. bake until crisp , about 5 to 8 minutes , turning once; 26. to serve , place rolls in soup plates; 27. ladle hot soup into and around"bowls; 28. top with cheese cubes; 29. garnish with basil or parsley , if desired; 30. serve immediately; 31. to freeze: pour into a rigid container , cover , label and freeze or bag; 32. to reheat: let thaw in the refrigerator; 33. place in saucepan and reheat gently on top of the stove , stirring occasionally; 34. to serve: top with cheese cubes and garnish; at the end of the summer when the hint of fall is in the air you are bound to have more tomatoes on the vine than you can handle! this is a way to make some great soup and use up some of those great tomatoes; crafty bergy s one pan beef pasta; 01/05/2004; time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, occasion, main dish, beef, pasta, potluck, dietary, one dish meal, low calorie, low carb, low in something, meat, pasta rice and grains, to go, 4 hours or less; 1. in a large frypan sprayed lightly with oil brown the beef strips- use high heat apprx 5 minutes; 2. remove beef strips; 3. turn heat to medium , add the mushrooms and onion to the fry pay , you may need to lightly spray the pan again with oil and saute until the onions are golden and the mushrooms browned; 4. add garlic saute 2 minutes put the beef strips back in the pan , add the mushroom soup , water , peppers , worcestershire sauce , pasta salt& pepper; 5. stir and bring it to a boil , add snow peas , stir; 6. if you are serving it right now add the parmesan to the pan; 7. mix well& serve nb do not mix in the cheese if you are finishing it later as a casserole if you are going to serve it as a casserole and finish it in the oven pour the mixture into a 9"x13" x3" lined with"release" foil or lightly greased casserole dish; 8. cover with foil and bake in a 350f oven for 30 minutes; 9. remove foil , sprinkle on the parmesan cheese return to oven for apprx 15 minutes or until the casserole is bubbly and the cheese melted; this was a kraft recipe but in their recipe they boiled the beef & pasta together with the soup and i didn't like the sound of that so i have changed it around completely and added some ingredients. you may either serve it right from the pan or make ahead and bake it like a casserole. i love do aheaders! [no need to peel the potatoes , unless you want to; 7. theyll cook fine unpeeled; 8. ]; 9. in a large pot or pan , bring salted water to a boil , add potatoes , and simmer them for about 8-9 minutes , or until the pieces are just done , but still quite firm; 10. if a toothpick is inserted into one , it should go in easily , but meet with a fair amount of resistance; 11. gently transfer the potatoes to a colander to drain; 12. while the potatoes are cooking , cook the bacon in a small skillet over medium heat until crisp; 13. transfer the cooked bacon to paper towels or newspaper or a brown paper bag to drain; 14. rub the cut potato planks generously with the olive oil; 15. sprinkle them generously on all sides with the salt and pepper; 16. place the pieces on the hot grill and cook until they have become really crispy and brown about 4 to 5 minutes per side; 17. serve topped with sour cream , and sprinkled with the bacon and cut chives; 18. variations: add toppings such as grated or shredded cheese , chopped chiles , avocado chunks , tomatoes or anything else that seems interesting to you; 19. you might offer a choice of toppings and let guests build their own !; one of my favorites chefs on radio melinda lee says: this dish is a meal in itself. great with only a simple salad alongside -- and it's also makes just a wonderful appetizer (especially if there will be a wait before dinner: these are filling). on the other hand, the potatoes are described in the new book by chris schlesinger and john willoughby as being a perfect accompaniment to a big, juicy steak. take your pick -- try them every which way -- and enjoy!; baking potatoes, bacon, olive oil, kosher salt, cracked black pepper, sour cream, chives, butter; 8

1. preheat oven to 375f; 2. saute the onion & garlic in the vegetable oil until the onion is translucent and the garlic is aromatic apprx 5 minutes; 3. add peppers & celery , cook a further 2 minutes; 4. add tomato sauce , sausage , potatoes & lemon juice; 5. sprinkle in the paprika; 6. add drained peas & carrots & wine; 7. bring to a simmer; 8. transfer to a casserole dish with a lid; 9. you may now continue to finish the dish or refrigerate it until 1 hour before serving bringing it to room temperature before placing it in the oven , if you have made this as a "do-ahead" allow 30 minutes at 375f to heat it to simmering; 10. if you are continuing with the recipe without "doing ahead" place the casserole in the 375f oven and bring the contents to a bubbling simmer 5-10 minutes; 11. make a depression for each egg , crack in the eggs , cover and place back in the oven; 12. cook for apprx 10-15 minutes or until the eggs are done to your liking; 13. have one or two eggs on top of the sausage / vegetable mixture on each plate or bring the whole caaserole to the table; a number of years ago in a village in spain i was served a dish similar to this recipe and thought of it as true comfort food.it was baked in a clay oven. it's been a while but this is my version of it. it was served for breakfast but i think of it more as a one dish dinner meal. it is an easy recipe with minimal preparation. you can make it ahead, reheat adding the eggs for the last 10 minutes. it can be as spicy or as tame as you like simply by  choosing a type of sausage that you like. if you can get portuguese linguica sausage they would be perfect. i used spanish corizo-a very robust sausage full of smoke &  flavor,  you may even try ham slices instead of sausage.  the cook time is for making the recipe straight through-for "do ahead" allow another 40 minutes; 1. boil the potatoes in plenty of water until tender , drain and keep aside; 2. in the meantime , heat oil in a pot; 3. add fenugreek seeds and allow it to crackle; 4. once it stops crackling and turns lightly golden brown , add cumin seeds and allow to crackle; 5. once it stops crackling , add 10-15 fresh curry leaves , green chillies and ginger; 6. mix well and stir-fry until the raw smell of ginger is gone; 7. this takes about 5 minutes; 8. then add gramflour and stir-fry it for 20 minutes , mixing it continuously , on low flame , until it is no longer raw taste-wise; 9. add the remaining 10 fresh curry leaves alongwith asafoetida powder; 10. stir-fry for 3-4 minutes on high flame; 11. stir in water , turmeric powder and red chilli powder; 12. add tomatoes , yam and flat indian beans; 13. bring to a boil; 14. lower flame , add 4 tsps; 15. of salt and mix well; 16. allow the curry to come to a boil twice again; 17. in the meantime , soak the ladyfinger with 1 tsp; 18. of salt in 1 cup of tamarind water; 19. bring this to a boil; 20. this step is done so as to ensure that the ladyfinger will not break while cooking in the curry; 21. add all the chopped vegetables now alongwith the ladyfinger mixture , mix well and boil for 30 minutes; 22. in the meantime , soak about 3 inches of tamarind in 1 cup of hot water and squeeze out the pulp from the tamarind as nicely as you can; 23. measure out 1 cup of this pulp; 24. this pulp is what i call'tamarind water; 25. now add this tamarind water to the curry; 26. boil for 30 minutes; 27. remove from flame , garnish with corriander leaves and serve hot with cooked long-grain basmati rice and / or low-fat plain yogurt for a complete meal in asian-indian curry and veggie food heaven !; 28. please; 29. you can use them if you wish to; 30. enjoy !; this is the traditional style in which we prepare sindhi curry. my dad is addicted to this just as he is dedicated to his favourite lentil curry(toor dal). even my picky eater bro does full justice to this curry. i stay away from this while watching my weight because of the fat in it. it is a very filling meal when served accompanied with rice and yogurt/a raita of your choice. it is very tasty! this is a family special that smells wonderful while cooking and for which we are famous among family and friends'. we take this at all the potluck parties we go to and it's the first thing to get over! it's sinful, but very good! i will be making this alot in us while on my holiday on dad's special request! hope you enjoy this as much as we all do!; brined pork roast; 17/05/2003; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, occasion, fruit, pork, oven, refrigerator, dinner party, fall, heirloom historical, holiday event, romantic, spring, summer, winter, easter, stove top, christmas, new years, seasonal, comfort food, independence day, berries, meat, mardi gras carnival, taste mood, savory, equipment, number of servings, presentation, served hot; 1. combine all ingredients in a saucepan; 2. bring to a boil , reduce heat , and simmer gently for 15 minutes; 3. cool to room temperature; 4. immerse pork roast of your choice in the cooled brine mixture , and refrigerate for 12 hours or overnight turning occasionally if necessary for even brining; 5. remove roast from brine , rinse , and pat dry with paper towels , and roast according to your favorite recipe until a thermometer , inserted in the center of the roast , reads 155 degrees; 6. allow the roast to rest for 20 minutes before carving; brining is a technique that is makes the roast more juicy, by making possible the accumulation of juices within the meat during cooking. the proportion of salt to water must be 1/3 to 1/2 cup per each 2 quarts of liquid (or 2/3 to 1 cup of salt per gallon), in order for this transformation to occur. the sugar balances the flavors, the herbs and spices have only a very subtle impact on the flavor of the finished dish. *cooking time for roast is not included as this is determined by the size of the roast!; water, kosher salt, granulated sugar, thyme, bay leaves, cloves, juniper berries, anise seed, black peppercorns, pork roast; 10

mandarin orange cheesecake; 25/07/2003; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north american, desserts, eggs dairy, fruit, american, oven, refrigerator, dinner party, holiday event, kid friendly, romantic, easter, cheesecake, eggs, dietary, copycat, christmas, thanksgiving, wedding, toddler friendly, citrus, oranges, novelty, taste mood, sweet, equipment, presentation, served cold; 1. to make cake layer , combine flour , baking powder and salt in a small bowl; 2. cream together butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a medium bowl; 3. add dry ingredients to the butter and mix well; 4. mix in milk , vanilla and 1 egg; 5. pour into a well-greased 9" springform pan; 6. slam pan down on the counter a few times to even out the batter; 7. bake in a preheated 350f oven for 15 minutes or until the cake is light brown on top; 8. for the cream cheese layer , combine gelatin with 3 / 4 cup sugar in a medium bowl; 9. add boiling water and stir until gelatin is dissolved; 10. set this aside; 11. prepare dream whip by whipping together 1 envelope of dream whip and 1 / 2 cup milk with an electric mixer in another medium bowl; 12. whip it good until the topping makes stiff peaks; 13. in another bowl , whip the cream cheese with vanilla , orange extract , lemon juice and food coloring in a large bowl until smooth; 14. slowly add the gelatin mixture while beating; 15. add half of the dream whip to the cream cheese mixture and beat until smooth; 16. pour this mixture over the cake layer in the springform pan; 17. chill for 2 hours or until firm; 18. pour all liquid except 1 / 2 cup from the cans of mandarin oranges wedges; 19. heat the 1 / 2 cup liquid in the microwave on high for 1 to 1 1 / 2 minutes or until hot; 20. dissolve 1 tsp unflavored gelatin in the liquid; 21. combine liquid with orange wedges and pour over the top of the firmed-up cheesecake that's still in the springform pan; 22. chill the cake for at least 2 more hours; 23. for the crunchy nut crust , combine 1 tbs water with 2 tbs sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat; 24. when sugar is dissolved and liquid begins to boil , add the hazelnuts and stir until nuts are well coated; 25. stir often until the water has cooked off , then continue to stir until the sugar begins to caramelize and turn light brown; 26. be careful not to burn the nuts; 27. the nuts are done when they are light brown and glazed with candied sugar; 28. pour the nuts onto a plate and let them cool completely; 29. when the candied nuts are cool , chop them up in a food processor until they are the consistency of crumbs; 30. make the icing by combining shortening with powdered sugar , milk and vanilla; 31. when mandarin orange gelatin has firmed up on top of the cake , remove the cake from the springform pan; 32. use a spatula to spread the icing around the edge of the cake; 33. press the hazelnut crumbs onto the icing around the edge of the cake; 34. chill the cake for at least another hour before serving; 35. to serve , cut cake into 8 slices; this is such a yummy cheesecake.  similar to benihana's recipe...not quite perfect.; all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, butter, granulated sugar, milk, vanilla extract, egg, unflavored gelatin, boiling water, dream whip, low-fat milk, cream cheese, orange extract, lemon juice, yellow food coloring, red food coloring, mandarin oranges, water, hazelnuts, shortening, powdered sugar, vanilla; maple glazed pork roast with sweet potatoes; 16/11/2002; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, 5 ingredients or less, main dish, pork, oven, easy, dietary, low sodium, low in something, meat, equipment, 4 hours or less; 1. preheat oven to 350f; 2. pat pork dry and season generously with salt and pepper; 3. sprinkle center of a flameproof roasting pan with 1 / 2 tablespoon flour; 4. set pork on flour in pan and roast in middle of oven 40 minutes; 5. brush pork with some maple syrup and roast , brushing with maple syrup every 10 minutes , until a thermometer inserted 2 inches into center of meat registers 155f , 20 to 25 minutes more; 6. while pork is roasting , peel potatoes and cut into 1 1 / 2-inch pieces; 7. in a kettle cover potatoes with salted cold water by 2 inches and simmer until tender , about 15 minutes; 8. drain potatoes in a colander set over a large bowl and reserve 3 cups cooking water; 9. return potatoes to kettle and mash with a potato masher , or pure in a food processor; 10. season potatoes with salt and pepper and keep warm; 11. transfer pork to a platter and let stand , loosely covered with foil , 10 minutes; 12. while pork is standing , skim fat from pan juices; 13. in a small bowl make a beurre mani by kneading together butter and remaining 4 tablespoons flour until smooth; 14. add 1 cup reserved cooking water to roasting pan and deglaze over moderately high heat , stirring and scraping up brown bits; 15. add remaining 2 cups cooking water and any juices that have accumulated on platter and bring mixture to a boil; 16. whisk in beurre mani and simmer sauce , whisking , until thickened to desired consistency , about 2 minutes; 17. pour sauce through a fine sieve into a sauceboat; 18. slice pork and serve with sweet potatoes and sauce; 19. serves 6 to 8; this recipe makes a delicious and flavorful roast. i use about 1/2 cup of maple syrup to baste the roast and add some brown sugar to the sweet potatoes when i mash them.  i left the original recipe unchanged here to post for you. i love sweet potatoes with pork! i hope you enjoy this one!; banana ginger crepes with yogurt; 24/01/2003; 60 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, occasion, pancakes and waffles, breakfast, desserts, eggs dairy, fruit, dinner party, cakes, nuts, eggs, stove top, cake fillings and frostings, equipment; 1. crepes: in your blender or food processor beat the eggs until creamy; 2. add sugar; 3. beat; 4. add milk; 5. beat; 6. slowly add flour and beat until very smooth; 7. wipe a non stick 12-inch skillet with a bit of butter or margarine; 8. pour in enough batter to form a thin layer , tilt the pan to spread it evenly over the bottom; 9. your layer should not be thicker than an 1 / 8-inch; 10. cook over medium heat , when the bottom is golden flip and cook for another minute place on a place and cover with a piece of wax paper; 11. continue to cook all the crepes; 12. cover the crepes with plastic wrap; 13. you may now freeze them for later use or have them ready for the last minute filling and serving; 14. filling: gently mix all the ingredients; 15. place a crepe on a serving plate and spoon on a generous amount of the filling; 16. flip up the bottom of the crepe and fold in the sides; 17. sprinkle with pine nuts and if you wish add a sprinkle of confectioners sugar; 18. allow 2 crepes per serving; 19. serve; this is a great "do most of the work ahead of time" recipe. i like to have crepes ready in the freezer for a quick tea time sweet or after dinner dessert.the combination of ginger, banana & yogurt will keep your guests guessing. the vanilla is optional or you may like some cinnamon in the filling.; flour, eggs, evaporated milk, whole milk, brown sugar, butter, plain yogurt, bananas, crystallized ginger, vanilla extract, pine nuts, confectioners' sugar; 12

quiche of ramen; 12/11/2008; 60 minutes or less, time to make, course, cuisine, preparation, main dish, european, inexpensive; 1. preheat oven to 375f; 2. lightly grease a 9" pie plate - use a deep pie plate or quiche dish; 3. break the ramen uncooked noodles apart so are in little pieces and form an even layer in the bottom of the pie plate; 4. cover the noodles with the well drained , well squeezed spinach , distribute evenly; 5. add the diced chicken , onion , & red pepper; 6. add the drained mushrooms and celery; 7. season with salt & pepper; 8. beat the eggs & milk together; 9. add the sambal olek , garlic & oregano to the eggs , mix; 10. pour eggs over the veggies; 11. bake at 375f after 30 minutes sprinkle on the parmesan and return to oven for apprx an additional 15 minutes to finish cooking or until a knife comes out clean inserted in the center of the quiche; brunch, lunch or dinner this is a satisfying meal served with a salad & perhaps a crusty roll. i have listed several ingredients as optional to keep this recipe as economical as possible. any quiche is flexible so add or detract at will. you can prepare this ahead of time and just pour the egg mixture over the veggies just before poppin it in the oven. use whatever peppers are on sale (green are usually the lowest priced). watch your cooking time as the size of your pan will affect the actual oven time - drizzle the cheese on when the quiche looks almost done.; ramen noodles, frozen spinach, chicken breasts, red pepper, onion, sliced mushrooms, celery, garlic cloves, salt & pepper, eggs, milk, sambal oelek, oregano, parmesan cheese; 14

italian panini burger; 28/05/2008; 60 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, occasion, lunch, main dish, pork, barbecue, easy, holiday event, stove top, sandwiches, meat, pork sausage, equipment, grilling; 1. form the italian sausage into 4 rectangular patties; 2. over medium heat pan fry the patties , brown one side flip , cover with lid and continue cooking until done , set aside keep warm or; 3. if your pan is large enough when you flip the patties add the onions & garlic , then the peppers and finish cooking all at once - otherwise follow along as suggested; 4. remove any excess grease from the pan; 5. meanwhile combine onions and garlic; 6. add onions & garlic to pan and cook until they are well browned; 7. apprx 8 minutes; 8. add peppers , tomatoes , basil & pine nuts cook 4 minutes; 9. lightly paint one side of the panini bread with oilive oil; 10. place a burger & 1 / 4 on the pepper mixture on 1 / 2 of the uncoated side of the panini , sprinkle with 1 / 4 of the parmesan , fold in half; 11. grill in a fry pan brown one side then the other; 12. an alternative method is to lay the panini flat , brown it & then add the patty & peppers etc; 13. or use your grill and brown both sides at once with the filling already inside; 14. serve with a nice green salad; i made this up as i viewed my frozen panini and my italian sausages..  i make 3 burgers out of one lb of meat but listed 4 in the instructions as 4 oz burgers seem to be the most popular..  i love hot italian and that is what i have listed but use mild if you prefer. bbq or pan fry the patties.  if you bbq fry up the pepper mixture separately while your burgers cook.make the patties rectangular so they fill the panini. one panini makes a healthy serving and you may decide to share but cutting it in two. hope you try this recipe and enjoy it; stuffed puff; 14/02/2007; 60 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, lunch, beef, ground beef, meat; 1. in a large skillet separate and fry your ground beef until it is cooked but not yet browned; 2. remove any grease from the skillet , add the tomato , onion , jalapeno pepper , ham or bacon , mushrooms & garlic; 3. stir fry until the vegetables are cooked; 4. add the soy sauce , worcestershire sauce & oregano; 5. continue cooking over low medium heat until the moisture has evaporated , season with salt & pepper; 6. allow to cool; 7. meanwhile roll out the puff pastry into two 12" squares , cut each square into four 6" pieces; 8. distribute the meat / vegetable mixture evenly on the center of each puff pastry square; 9. fold one corner over to form a triangle and press the edges well together so they will not separate while baking , cut a small slit on the top of each puff; 10. at this point you may place the stuffed puffs on a cookie sheet and freeze them , when frozen wrap them well and place them in your freezer; 11. when you want to bake them allow them to defrost in your fridge for 2-3 hours before baking; 12. continue with the final step; 13. place the freshly made puffs on a cookie sheet in the center of a 400 degree preheated oven for approx 20 minutes or until they are nicely browned and cooked; 14. serve warm; 15. you may want to , but not necessary , to serve a sauce on the side catsup , bbq , steak sauce or your favorite sauce , enjoy; this is a versatile recipe that is great for lunch with a green salad, as a snack, or make tiny ones to serve as appetizers. they are freezer friendly. for large lunch appetites you may want to serve two per person. the recipe is medium"hot" if you want spicy hot add another jalapeno the size and packaging of the puff pastry may vary from country to country. you will want to end up with eight 6" squares approx 1/8" thick.; puff pastry, lean ground beef, whole tomato, white onion, jalapeno pepper, ham, fresh mushrooms, garlic cloves, soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, dried oregano, salt & pepper; 12

1. brown meat in a large pot; 2. drain; 3. stir in celery , garlic , onion , green pepper , salt and pepper; 4. cover and simmer about 10 minutes until vegetables are tender but not soft; 5. you can use this mixture immediately during your cooking session or freeze in two-cup portions for later use; 6. suggested uses; 7. tacos: add one package taco seasoning to two cups all-purpose ground meat mix; 8. freeze; 9. to serve: thaw and heat taco mixture; 10. prepare tacos as you would normally; 11. taco potatoes: follow instructions for taco mixture , but serve the mixture over baked potatoes instead of tortillas or taco shells; 12. top with grated cheese , diced tomatoes , sour cream , sliced green onions , sliced black olives and salsa; 13. easy taco salads: follow instructions for taco mixture; 14. place a layer of corn chips or tortilla chips on plate; 15. spoon taco mixture over chips; 16. add layer of shredded lettuce; 17. add diced tomatoes , sliced green onions , sliced black olives , sour cream and salsa; 18. sloppy joes: in a large skillet , place two cups ground meat mix , one can tomato soup , two tablespoons brown sugar , and one teaspoon prepared mustard; 19. stir; 20. cover and simmer ten minutes; 21. serve ladled onto hamburger buns; 22. the all-purpose ground meat mix can also be used for: stuffed peppers , chili , spaghetti , and baked ziti; 23. see my cookbook for additional ideas: [url= to make with all purpose ground beef mix[ / url]; one of the easiest ways to save money on your family's grocery bill is by purchasing foods in bulk when they go on sale. when ground meat goes on sale, rather than just stocking up to store in the freezer "as is," many cooks find it helpful to prepare meat mixes for using later in their favorite family recipes. by preparing this recipe for all-purpose ground meat mix, you'll be ready to fix any number of tasty ground meat recipes without needing to brown the meat, onions and spices each time you cook. not only will this technique save you money, it saves time too. the following recipe is from the book "frozen assets: how to cook for a day and eat for a month"; pumpkin gratin polenta with spinach mushrooms and feta; 11/10/2005; time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north american, main dish, vegetables, oven, dinner party, fall, holiday event, vegetarian, winter, stove top, dietary, seasonal, mushrooms, greens, spinach, squash, equipment, 4 hours or less; 1. bake the butternut pumpkin; 2. if you're doing this ahead of time , just cut it into a few pieces , scoop out the seeds , and place on a baking tray and bake at moderate heat for an hour or so until soft , then remove the flesh from the skin; 3. if you're in a hurry , skin and seed the pumpkin then cut into smallish cubes; 4. toss with a bit of olive oil , then bake at 350f for about 20-30 minutes until soft; 5. puree it with a potato masher or implement of choice; 6. stir the polenta into the cold water in an ample pot , add the vegetable stock , and bring it to a simmer , stirring constantly; 7. continue stirring until the polenta is thick and tender , about half an hour; 8. remove from the heat , then stir in the pureed pumpkin and the butter , and add a little salt and pepper; 9. remember that you will be layering it with salty feta , so use a light hand; 10. pour the polenta onto a large baking sheet and smooth it into a 1 / 2 inch layer; 11. allow it to stiffen , then cut into rectangles about 2x3 inches in size; 12. meanwhile , peel , halve and slice the red onions; 13. warm the oil in a large non-stick pan over a low-moderate heat; 14. add the onions and a dash of salt , and cover; 15. cook for about 15 minutes , stirring now and then , then remove the lid and cook another 15 minutes or more; 16. when the onions are very soft , add the balsamic vinegar to taste and cook another 5 minutes , then remove from the heat and set aside; 17. wipe and slice the mushrooms; 18. heat the butter or oil and cook the mushrooms until they're a lovely dark brown; 19. season with salt and pepper and set aside; 20. remove tough stems from the spinach and wash the leaves well , then chop roughly; 21. in a large saucepan , heat a bit of oil and add the peeled and chopped garlic; 22. saute for a minute or two , then add the spinach; 23. put the lid on the pan , and cook for several minutes , turning the leaves with tongs every couple of minutes to stop them sticking; 24. when the leaves are wilted and tender , remove them from the heat and; 25. in a bowl , mix together the spinach , mushrooms , onions and most of the crumbled feta; 26. lightly oil a large gratin or lasagne dish; 27. spoon a little of the vegetable mixture into one end of the dish , then start overlapping layers of the polenta slices with layers of the vegetable mixture , leaving some of the filling showing between layers of polenta; 28. you'll have to judge how upright to layer the slices based on the size of your dish; 29. once you have used up all the filling and polenta , sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top; 30. bake at 350f for about 30 minutes; 31. it should be bubbling hot , and the cheese on top will be golden brown in spots; 32. let it sit for 5 minutes , then serve; this is good...i know it seems like a lot to do but you will be happy you did.  try to get good polenta, not the fast cook stuff. it makes a difference.; butternut pumpkin, polenta, water, vegetable stock, butter, olive oil, red onions, salt, balsamic vinegar, mushroom, sea salt, pepper, garlic cloves, spinach, feta cheese; 15

5. lightly grease a heavy or non stick pancake or crepe pan and heat it until it is very hot; 6. pour in just enough batter to cover the base of the pan , swirling it to cover the pan evenly; 7. cook until the crepe has set and is golden , then turn it to cook the other side; 8. remove the crepe to a sheet of kitchen paper; 9. cook the remaining batter to make 6 to 8 crepes; 10. place six small ovenproof bowls or moulds on a baking sheet up side down and lay the pancakes over these; 11. bake them in the oven for about 10 minutes or until they are crisp and set into shape; 12. lift the baskets off the moulds; 13. pare a thin piece of orange rind from on orange and cut it into fine strips; purely simple guacamole; 05/09/2007; 15 minutes or less, time to make, course, cuisine, preparation, low protein, healthy, appetizers, easy, no cook, dips, south american, dietary, low cholesterol, low carb, healthy 2, low in something, technique; 1. grind 1 tbs finely chopped white onion , 1 firmly packed tbs chopped fresh cilantro , 2 tsp finely chopped jalapeno , and 1 tsp salt in a molcajete until all ingredients are well ground; 2. cut 3 medium-ripe hass avocados in half; 3. twist the halves to separate them and remove the pit with the; 4. place an avocado half , cut side up , in the palm of your hand and make 3 or 4 evenly spaced lengthwise cuts through its flesh down to the skin , without cutting through the skin; 5. make 4 cross-wise cuts in the same fashion; 6. scoop the diced avocado flesh into the molcajete; 7. repeat with remaining avocado halves; 8. gently fold the avocado into the chile-onion paste , keeping the avocado pieces fairly in tact; 9. add 3 tbs diced tomato , 2 firmly packed tbs chopped fresh cilantro , and 1 tbs finely chopped white onion; 10. fold together all the ingredients; 11. taste and add salt , if desired; 12. serve immediately , directly from molcajete , with tortilla chips; in my opinion the fresh and simple is best when considering a guacamole recipe.  i know lots of recipes add lots of peppers and spices to doctor the flavor.  but i like the flavors of  the vegetables to highlight my guacamole.  i found this recipe in the september issue of saveur magazine. it originally comes from rosa mexicano restaurant in new york city, where the guacamole is prepared fresh at your table side using a traditional molcajete (a mortar made of volcanic rock). in preparing this recipe, if you do not have a molcajete, you can use a mortar and pestle, or a bowl and the back tines of a fork to combine ingredients, which will work just as well. i love this recipe and it has become my favorite.  i hope you will enjoy it, too!; 1. pat chicken dry and season with salt; 2. heat 2 tablespoons oil in a 10- to 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking , then brown chicken in batches , without crowding , turning once , 6 to 8 minutes total; 3. transfer to a bowl as browned; 4. reduce heat to moderate and brown sausage in 4 batches in fat remaining in skillet , turning , 3 to 4 minutes; 5. transfer to a paper-towel-lined bowl as browned; 6. pour off all but about 1 tablespoon fat from skillet , then cook onions , celery , and bell pepper in skillet over moderate heat , stirring occasionally , until onions are golden brown and softened , about 8 minutes; 7. add garlic and cook , stirring , 1 minute; 8. add 1 cup stock and cook , stirring , 1 minute; 9. transfer mixture to a wide 8-quart heavy pot and add chicken , water , tomatoes , cayenne , and remaining cup stock; 10. simmer , partially covered , until chicken is tender , about 30 minutes; 11. preheat oven to 325f; 12. transfer chicken with tongs to a clean bowl and measure cooking liquid with vegetables , adding additional water as necessary to measure 7 cups; 13. if over 7 cups , boil to reduce; 14. stir rice into cooking liquid; 15. arrange chicken over rice , then bring to a boil over high heat , uncovered , without stirring; 16. bake , covered , in middle of oven until rice is tender and most of liquid is absorbed , about 30 minutes; cheddar   jack crackers; 09/10/2003; 30 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north american, appetizers, lunch, snacks, eggs dairy, canadian, oven, dinner party, holiday event, cheese, freezer, inexpensive, british columbian, brunch, equipment, number of servings; 1. lightly spoon flour into a dry measuring cup , and level with a knife; 2. combine flour and next 5 ingredients in a large bowl , stirring with a whisk; 3. cut in butter with a pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse meal; 4. add cheese , water and vinegar , stir until mixture just comes together; 5. divide dough into 4 equal portions , shaping each into a ball; 6. wrap each ball in plastic wrap; 7. cover and freeze 30 minutes; 8. preheat oven to 375f degrees; 9. roll 1 ball into an 8 inch circle on parchment paper , on lightly floured surface; 10. sprinkle dough with 1 / 2 teaspoon seeds , and lightly press the seeds into dough; 11. cut dough into 8 wedges , do not separate wedges; 12. place dough on a large baking sheet; 13. repeat procedure with remaining dough and seeds , arranging on 2 baking sheets; 14. bake at 375f degrees for 10 minutes or until crackers are brown and crispy; 15. cool completely on a wire rack; 16. separate into wedges; these home made crackers are far superior to any you can purchase and go wonderfully with all those great winter soups. also work well as holders of appetizers and use with dips or even alone. we love 'em! adapted from cooking light. 30 minute chill (freeze) time not included in cook or prep time.; all-purpose flour, yellow cornmeal, sugar, baking soda, salt, cayenne pepper, butter, monterey jack and cheddar cheese blend, ice water, white vinegar, poppy seeds; 11

creme anglaise   vanilla custard sauce; 16/04/2003; 60 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, desserts, eggs dairy, puddings and mousses, eggs, stove top, equipment, number of servings; 1. pour the milk and cream into to medium-sized saucepan; 2. if using vanilla bean , scrape the seeds into the pan and then add the bean itself; 3. heat the milk until bubbles appear around the edge; 4. remove the pan from the heat and set aside for 15 minutes to let the milk absorb the vanilla; 5. remove and discard the bean; 6. beat the egg yolks with the sugar and vanilla extract , if using , until light and foamy , about 3 minutes; 7. starting with a few tablespoons , very gradually stir in the hot milk; 8. return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over medium heat , stirring constantly with a wooden spoon , until the custard starts to thicken slightly; 9. be very careful not to let the custard come to a boil or it will curdle; 10. allow the custard to cool completely and refrigerate; 11. variation: flavor your custard with the grated zest of 1 / 2 lemon or orange instead of the vanilla; 12. or add a tbs or so of grand marnier , kirsch , or kahlua to the finish custard; a rich silky vanilla custard sauce to serve with poached fruits, cakes and puddings, creme anglaise is very easy to make. but remember, once the egg yolks are added, the sauce must never come to a boil or the eggs will curdle. it is useful to have on hand a large bowl filled with ice cubes into which you can plunge the saucepan and stop the cooking immediately.; milk, heavy cream, vanilla beans, egg yolks, sugar; 5

1. for the cake-----------; 2. preheat oven to 325f degrees; 3. butter and flour 9" diameter cake pan with 2" high sides; 4. using electric mixer , beat 1 cup sugar , almond paste and butter in large bowl to blend; 5. add yolks , extract and salt and beat 1 minute; 6. on low speed , beat in flour alternately with milk in 3 additions each; 7. mix in coconut; 8. using electric mixer fitted with clean dry beaters , beat whites in large bowl to soft peaks; 9. gradually beat in remaining 1 / 4 cup sugar and beat until stiff but not dry; 10. fold whites into batter; 11. pour batter into prepared pan; 12. bake until tester inserted into center comes out clean , about 1 hour; 13. cool cake in pan on rack 20 minutes; 14. run small sharp knife around sides to loosen cake; 15. turn out cake onto rack; 16. cool completely; 17. for filling-----------; 18. bring cream of coconut and butter to simmer in heavy medium saucepan over low heat; 19. add white chocolate; 20. stir until melted; 21. pour into bowl and cool; 22. add cream cheese and beat until smooth; 23. mix in coconut; 24. chill until spreadable , about 30 minutes; 25. for glaze-----------; 26. bring 3 / 4 cup whipping cream and corm syrup to a simmer in heavy medium saucepan; 27. add chocolate and stir until melted and smooth; 28. cool until just pourable , about 15 minutes; 29. using serrated knife , cut cake horizontally in half; 30. place 1 cake layer cut side up on plate; 31. spread filling over; 32. top with second cake layer cut side down; 33. pour half of glaze over top of cake , spreading with spatula to cover sides and smooth top; 34. press almonds around sides and in 1" border around top edge of cake; 35. refridgerate cake until glaze sets , about 1 hour; 36. mix reserved glaze and remaining 1 / 4 cup whipping cream in saucepan; 1. drop almonds and cashewnuts in 2 separate pans of boiling water; 2. boil for 30 minutes and drain; 3. peel the almonds by slipping them out of their skins and place in a food processor with the boiled cashewnuts; 4. whiz until they form a paste; 5. meanwhile , peel , wash and de-vein the prawns by making a small incision down the length of the back of each prawn and removing its black digestive cord; 6. wash and pat dry; 7. crumble saffron into warm milk; 8. leave to infuse; 9. remove the tiny black cardamom seeds and grind to a fine powder; 10. set aside; 11. heat the ghee in a wide pan over medium-high flame; 12. saute the onions until golden and the oil starts to separate from them; 13. add chillies and ginger; 14. cook for 1-2 minutes , stirring regularly , then mix in the nut paste and keep stirring until the ghee separates out and the paste leaves the sides of the pan; 15. add the prawns and 2 tbsps; 16. of cold water; 17. keep stirring , adding a further 2 tbsps of cold water two or three times , until the prawns begin to turn pink and the sauce is a nice consistency; 18. mix in the saffron-milk mixture , season to taste and simmer for a minute until prawns are cooked; 19. finally , add the cream and once hot transfer to a serving dish; 20. sprinkle with cardamom powder and fresh green corriander leaves; 21. serve hot with steamed basmati white rice; i found this recipe some months back in the 'weekend magazine". this is a very traditional simple bengali, indian curry. my brother, who loves non-veg. food, seems to lick his fingers clean everytime we make it for him.; chilli paneer  tofu  kofta naramdil   spicy soft hearted tofu; 04/11/2002; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, main dish, beans, asian, indian, holiday event, vegetarian, stove top, dietary, valentines day, soy tofu, equipment, 4 hours or less; 1. mix all the ingredients mentioned above"filling; 2. leave 1 / 4 of the mixture for the centre filling and make 18-20 balls out of the rest; 3. keep aside; 4. i'll call this"white mixture; 5. likewise , mix all the ingredients mentioned under"filling" and make 18-20 tiny yellow paneer balls; 6. keep aside; 7. i'll call this"yellow mixture; 8. now , flatten the"white mixture" on your palm; 9. place the"yellow mixture" in the centre; 10. close the top and make smooth balls; 11. keep aside; 12. heat oil in a wok; 13. very gently , fry the above made balls till golden brown; 14. drain on clean kitchen paper towels and keep aside; 15. now , start with the gravy; 16. for this , put the bay leaves in 4 teaspoons; 17. oil; 18. add the onion paste; 19. stir-fry till brown; 20. add ginger and garlic pastes; 21. stir-fry till the raw smell of the same leaves the mixture; 22. add tomatoes; 23. fry till the fat leaves the masala; 24. add salt , turmeric powder , corriander powder and red chilli powder; 25. add cream; 26. add water; 27. cook , uncovered , till half the water evaporates; 28. just before you serve , add the koftas; 29. simmer on low flame for 5-7 minutes; 30. remove the koftas very gently so as to be careful that they do not break; 31. put the koftas in a serving bowl; 32. pour the gravy over the koftas; 33. sprinkle garam masala on top; 34. add a little cream on top; 35. garnish with corriander leaves; 36. serve with hot steamed basmati white rice for a wonderful lunch / dinner party; i love paneer(tofu) and so does my family! 1. in a large plastic bag , shake together flour , salt and pepper; 2. cut steak into 8 pieces; 3. one piece at a time , seal steak in bag; 4. pound with meat mallet to 1 / 4 inch thikcness , working flour mixture into meat; 5. reserve any remaining flour mixture; 6. in a dutch oven , heat oil over medium high heat; 7. brown meat well , in batches if necessary; 8. remove to plate; 9. add bacon to pan; 10. cook over medium heat until crisp , about 5 minutes; 11. drain off fat; 12. add onions , garlic , celery , cajun seasoning and thyme; 13. cook , stirring until onions are softened , about 5 minutes; 14. sprinkle with any reserved flour mixture , cook , stirring for 1 minute; 15. whisk tomato paste into stock; 16. pour into pan ,; 17. return steaks and any accumulated juices to pan; 18. cover and simmer over low heat , turning steaks halfway through , 1 hour and 45 minutes; 19. add green pepper; 20. simmer , covered until steaks are fork tender and green pepper is tender crisp , about 15 minutes; 21. sprinkle with green onions and parsley; 22. crockpot version: follow first paragraph as directed , in frypan , brown meat , transfer to crockpot; 23. whisk tomato paste into 2 cups beef stock; 24. pour into frypan and bring to boil , scraping up brown bits , pour into crockpot; 25. add remaining ingredients , except green pepper , green onions and parsley; 26. cover and cook , stirring twice , until meat is tender , on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 to 6 hours; 27. add green pepper , cook on high for 15 minutes; 28. serve sprinkled with fresh onions and parsley; real comfort food!!! serve over garlic mashed potatoes with a side of corn. 1. for crust: whisk flour and salt in large bowl to blend; 2. add butter and shortening and rub in with finger; 3. sprinkle with 3 tablespoons water; 4. toss until moist clumps form , adding more water by teaspoonfuls if mixture is dry; 5. gather dough into ball; 6. divide in half; 7. flatten into disks; 8. wrap in plastic; 9. chill at least 1 hour; 10. for filling: preheat oven to 400f; 11. spray 9-inch-diameter deep-dish glass pie dish with nonstick spray; 12. stir all apples , 3 / 4 cup sugar , lemon juice , 1 / 2 teaspoon cinnamon , and vanilla in large bowl to blend; 13. let stand until juices form , about 15 minutes; 14. mix in flour; 15. roll out 1 dough disk on lightly floured surface to 12-inch round; 16. place dough in prepared pie dish; 17. spoon in filling; 18. dot with butter; 19. roll out second dough disk to 13-inch round; 20. using small bottle cap , cut out ten 1 / 2-inch-diameter circles from dough for decoration; 21. discard circles; 22. drape dough over filling; 23. seal top and bottom crust edges together; 24. trim to 1 / 2-inch overhang; 25. fold overhang under; 26. crimp decoratively; 27. brush pie with milk; 28. combine remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and large pinch of cinnamon in small bowl; 29. sprinkle over pie; 30. transfer pie to baking sheet; 31. place in oven; 32. immediately reduce temperature to 375f; 33. bake pie until crust is golden brown , apples are tender and filling is bubbling thickly , covering edge with foil if browning too quickly , about 1 hour; 34. cool 30 minutes; 35. serve warm or at room temperature; 1. for marinade , combine lime peel , lime juice , tequila , the 3 tbs orange juice or tequila , the oil , salt , and pepper; 2. place turkey breast in a self-sealing plastic bag set in a large bowl; 3. pour marinade over turkey; 4. seal bag; 5. turn to coat breast; 6. marinate in refrigerator at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours , turning occasionally; 7. lift turkey breast from bag , reserving 1 cup of the marinade , cover reserved marinade and refrigerate until ready to make sauce; 8. discard any remaining marinade; 9. place turkey , skin side up , on a rack in a shallow roasting pan; 10. insert a meat thermometer into thickest part of the breast , without touching bone; 11. roast , uncovered in a 325f oven for 2 1 / 4-2 1 / 2 hours or until thermometer registers 170f; 12. transfer turkey to a cutting board , cover with foil; 13. let stand 10-15 minutes before carving meanwhile , for margarita sauce , in a small saucepan stir the reserved marinade into cornstarch; 14. cook and stir until thickened and bubbly; 15. cook and stir 2 minutes more; 16. to serve , thinly slice 1 / 3 of the turkey breast; 17. serve with the margarita sauce; 18. cut up and store remaining turkey as follows: divide remaining turkey breast in half; 19. cube half; 20. shred the other half place cube and shredded turkey in separate self-sealing plastic bags or freezer bags; 21. seal and refrigerate up to 3 days or label and freeze up to 3 months; 22. this turkey is great for turkey taco salad or turkey tortilla soup !; 23. before using , thaw turkey overnight in refrigerator , if frozen; this is great to serve on the day or to use as a make ahead meal. why wait for the holidays to roast turkey! makes for great sandwiches, turkey taco salads, casseroles, or turkey tortilla soup!; 5. and flour are well mixed; 6. you may want to add the remaining water; 7. the dough should be pliable but not too sticky; 8. mix the wasabi , egg white & yam; 9. add this to the dough and thoroughly work it inches; 16. oil a skillet and over medium high heat brown both sides of the tortilla , apprx 2 minutes per side; 17. place in foil and keep warm in a low oven while you make the sauce& stir fry; 18. sauce: mix all the sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside; these tortillas are delightfully different & tasty. they are good with soup too or on their own as a snack. you may vary your stir fry vegetable to suit your taste. the dough is very easy to work with, just keep dusting the board with buckwheat flour.  in one of the photos you will see just the stir fry no buckwheat tortilla. i also added green beans.  the recipe is quite vesatile - use it as you will; the ramchandani s homemade famous mango milkshake  amras; 23/05/2003; 30 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, 5 ingredients or less, beverages, desserts, fruit, asian, indian, easy, no cook, refrigerator, dinner party, holiday event, kid friendly, picnic, romantic, summer, vegetarian, food processor blender, dietary, seasonal, shakes, comfort food, ramadan, valentines day, toddler friendly, tropical fruit, mango, brunch, taste mood, sweet, to go, equipment, small appliance, presentation, served cold, technique; 1. put the diced mangoes in a large mixing bowl; 2. add sugar; 3. using an electric beater , beat well until the mango pieces break and become mushy; 4. beat really well !; 5. then add cold milk , a little at a time; 6. beat well again until not even a tiny piece of mango remains -- you will get an aromatic mango smell emanating from the mixing bowl and a beautiful thick milkshake; 7. add some freshly grated coconut for a nice variation; 8. cover the bowl; 9. refrigerate until it's nice and cold; 10. serve chilled; 11. this is to be served with puris; 12. this is the secret to the extra pounds that everyone has in my family !; we make this every year in the summers. this is my dad's most favourite comfort food! i still remember him dipping little pieces of puris (we make these also at home) in the mango milkshake and feeding me when i'd come home tired from school! he would say this is specially made by papa for his april diamond :)! the best part about this recipe is that you can serve this as a beverage alongside your food or as a dessert along with homemade puris! what a wonderful treat this is - i swear you'll never make anything with mangoes once you make this and enjoy this delish yummy shake! you can make lots of this, pour it into a water jug and carry it with you for a picnic! :) i hope everyone who loves mangoes tries this and enjoys it just as much as we do!!; alphonso mangoes, sugar, milk; 3

mexican bolillos  crusty oval rolls; 01/10/2001; weeknight, time to make, course, cuisine, preparation, occasion, north american, healthy, breads, breakfast, mexican, oven, dinner party, low fat, rolls biscuits, dietary, low cholesterol, low saturated fat, healthy 2, yeast, low in something, equipment, number of servings, 4 hours or less; 1. sprinkle yeast over the warm water in a large mixing bowl; 2. stir and let stand 5 minutes; 3. when the yeast is working a bit stir the honey , lard and salt into the yeast mixture; 4. add 2 1 / 2 cups flour; 5. mix at low speed and then beat at medium speed until the dough is very elastic , about 5 minutes; 6. gradually stir in as much of the remaining flour as needed to make a soft dough; 7. knead on floured surface until dough is smooth in texture and very elastic , 15-20 minutes; 8. place dough in a greased bowl , turn the dough so all surfaces have a sheen of oil; 9. cover and let rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size , about 1 hour; 10. punch the dough down and knead briefly on a floured surface; 11. divide dough into 10 pieces and roll into balls; 12. work with the palms of your hands and start at the center of each ball to roll out into ovals; 13. each piece should be about 5 1 / 2" long and 2" in the middle , tapering to each end; 14. place rolls on a greased baking sheet , cover and let rise until almost doubled , about 25 minutes; 15. meanwhile heat oven to 375f degrees; 16. mix cornstarch and cold water , heat stirring constantly to boiling , boil until thickened and clear about 2 minutes; 17. brush each roll with the cornstarch mixture; 18. slash each roll down the middle stopping about 1 / 2" from each end and cutting about 1 / 2" deep; 19. bake until the rolls are brown and sound hollow when tapped , about 30-35 minutes; 20. remove from baking sheets and cool on racks; 21. serve warm & fresh from the oven; bolillos next to the tortilla is a staple to mexico. nearly every villiage has a bakery and every bakery makes bolillos, fabulous for breakfast with a little butter and fresh fruit. bolillos go stale quickly and are at their best right from the oven . great for any meal where you want a crisp roll; active dry yeast, warm water, honey, lard, salt, flour, cold water, cornstarch; 8

timballo di maccarun  molded macaroni casserole; 12/02/2003; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, casseroles, main dish, pasta, oven, european, dinner party, italian, one dish meal, comfort food, pasta rice and grains, elbow macaroni, taste mood, equipment, 4 hours or less; 1. in a bowl , gently combine the ground meats; 2. in a separate bowl of water , dip the bread slices just until softened , then squeeze out the water , crumble the bread , and add to the meats along with the eggs , herbs , salt , pepper , and parmigiano-reggiano cheese; 3. mix just to combine the ingredients; 4. set aside; 5. in a separate bowl , combine the cooked macaroni with the remaining cheeses and 1 cup of tomato sauce; 6. set aside; 7. grease the bottom and sides of a 9-inch springform pan with olive oil; 8. cut a piece of parchment paper to fit the bottom of the pan; 9. place the slices of prosciutto or pancetta in the bottom of the pan in a spoke-like or circle fashion; 10. cover the slices and sides of the pan with about two thirds of the meat mixture; 11. make sure there are no gaps; 12. gently fill the center of the pan with the macaroni mixture , patting it down firmly; 13. with a rolling pin , roll the remaining meat mixture between 2 sheets of waxed paper to fit the top of the pan; 14. remove 1 sheet of the waxed paper and invert the meat over the top of the pan; 15. carefully pull back the remaining sheet of waxed paper; 16. neatly press the edges of the meat all the way around the pan , making sure that there are no gaps; 17. preheat the oven to 350f; 18. cover the top of the pan tightly with a piece of aluminum foil; 19. place the pan on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes , covered; 20. remove the foil and bake 15 minutes longer , or until the meat is browned on top; 21. remove the pan from the oven; 22. run a knife around the edges of the pan; 23. place a serving platter over the pan and invert onto the platter; 24. with a potholder , carefully release the spring and lift off the sides of the pan; 25. remove the bottom of the pan and the parchment paper; 26. let the timballo cool for 5 to 10 minutes; 27. serve the timballo cut into wedges and pass extra tomato sauce on the side; this recipe is from nella cucina. in this recipe the familiar elbow shape is used to make an impressive molded casserole called a timballo.; oriental finger food  rolled chicken   mushroom omelette; 12/04/2005; 30 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, preparation, occasion, appetizers, eggs dairy, poultry, dinner party, finger food, eggs, dietary, meat, presentation; 1. add dried shitake mushrooms to boiling water & simmer 1 minute remove from heat and let them sit for ten minutes , drain and chop finely; 2. in a fry pan saute the minced chicken & garlic until cooked and the chicken is lightly browned , make sure the chicken is well separated; 3. add ginger , soy , chili flakes , reconstituted , chopped mushrooms , wine & lemon juice; 4. simmer until the moisture has evaporated - set aside to cool; 5. meanwhile whisk the 2 eggs with the water & cornstarch; 6. whip the egg white until it forms soft peaks; 7. mix the egg white with the cooled chicken mixture ,; 8. fold the chicken mixture into the whisked eggs; 9. heat a no stick omelette pan over medium high heat; 10. pour in half of the mixture and tilt the pan so you have as thin a layer as possible , cook until bubbly on top; 11. it should be almost totally cooked; 12. tilt the pan and pick up an edge of the omelette & roll it into a jellyroll; 13. leave over heat turning the roll to finish heating through for another minute , remove roll to a plate; 14. cook second omelette; 15. insert 6 toothpick in each roll about 3 / 4" apart and slice between them giving you 4 small end pieces and 12 pieces to serve; 16. place each piece rolled side up on a serving platter , put a dab of chili sauce on top of each and a piece of ginger serve at room temperature; tasty, easy, economical appetizer.  they seem to disappear quickly too.  in this recipe i have used chicken that i minced very finely.a small half breast skinless will do the trick. you could substitute leftover meat, fish or seafood for the chicken . i have put the chili sauce and ginger as optional but i recommend that you use both as they give that final flavor burst. serve at room temperature . you may make these several hours ahead,store them in the fridge bring out 45 minutes before serving. the recipe can be doubled or tripled.; vegetable oil, chicken, garlic cloves, onions, powdered ginger, light soy sauce, chili flakes, shiitake mushrooms, white wine, lemon juice, egg white, eggs, water, cornstarch, salt, crystallized ginger, hot chili sauce; brown rice  nut   tempeh casserole; 02/11/2001; weeknight, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, north american, casseroles, main dish, beans, fruit, rice, vegetables, american, oven, vegan, vegetarian, nuts, stove top, dietary, one dish meal, pacific northwest, soy tofu, tempeh, pasta rice and grains, equipment, 4 hours or less; 1. put the tempeh in a saucepan , add bay leaf and half the veggie stock; 2. cover and simmer 10 minutes; 3. cool tempeh , remove bay leaf , reserve the stock; 4. cook rice until tender in 2 cups veggie stock , about 40 minutes; 5. if any stock left , reserve and add to final baking; 6. grate , crumble or cut small the tempeh and combine with: tamari , marjoram , thyme and garlic heat skillet and saute in the olive oil , onion and celery about 10 minutes; 7. add tempeh and cook for a few minutes more; 8. mix rice , onions , celery , pecans parsley and left over liquid from cooking tempeh; 9. spoon into a lightly oiled baking dish; 10. cover and bake at 350f for 15 minutes; 11. remove cover and bake another 15 minutes; 12. serve; 13. if you wish to make this casserole ahead and do the final baking before serving: cover and refrigerate , bring to room temp and then bake covered for 30 minutes; this recipe is from "the tempeh cook book" by dorothy bates. it is wonderful hot or cold. the flavor is heavenly and it is so good it makes people think that being a vegetarian isn't so bad after all!the comment beside the recipe is"this is good enough to serve with pride for thanksgiving day dinner"; tempeh, bay leaf, vegetable stock, brown rice, tamari, marjoram, thyme, garlic powder, olive oil, onion, celery, pecans, parsley; 13

very tasty yellow moong dal  yellow lentils  and rice khichdi; 22/02/2003; 60 minutes or less, time to make, course, main ingredient, cuisine, preparation, occasion, for large groups, healthy, lunch, beans, asian, indian, low fat, vegetarian, stove top, dietary, low cholesterol, low saturated fat, low calorie, lentils, healthy 2, low in something, brunch, equipment, number of servings; 1. heat oil in a skillet; 2. add cumin seeds; 3. allow to splutter; 4. fold in yellow lentils and rice; 5. stir in salt and water; 6. bring to a boil; 7. lower flame , partially cover and cook till the water has evaporated and rice is cooked; 8. serve hot; 9. this can be served all by itself , though , the actual combination is this khichdi with plain yogurt; this is one of my most favourite dishes. khichdi=rice and lentil mixture. this is what i have been eating since y'day(this is given when one has loose motions). also, this makes very good food for the pigeons and crows! try feeding it to them(minus the yogurt), i.e., just the plain khichdi after allowing it to cool down, o my, they'll bless you. i have just shared mine with them and you have to come here to my place to watch how happily the crows and pigoens have feasted on this:) in india, this recipe is made every year on the eighth day of the festival of durga ashtami. we make it here in oman as well, in our home, every year for ashtami and serve it with traditional potato curry and yogurt, mmmmmmmm:) little children love this recipe and most mom's often feed this to their children to ensure they have a good balance of proteins(which comes from the yellow lentils) and carbohydrates(which comes from the rice). i really love this recipe:); yellow lentils, basmati rice, water, salt, cumin seeds, oil; 6
